module.name: laz2_XMLRead
module.short: Provides routines used to read XML content from a file, text file, or stream

descr.p: laz2_xmlread.pas provides routines used to read XML content from a file, text file, or stream. It is copied from the FCL unit xmlread.pp (SVN revision 15251), and adapted to use UTF-8 instead of widestrings by Mattias Gaertner.

Modified in 2006 by Sergei Gorelkin, sergei_gorelkin@mail.ru
Converted to use UTF-8 instead of widestrings by Mattias Gaertner.

element.name: TErrorSeverity
element.short: Represents error severity codes for XML read operations

descr.p: TErrorSeverity is an enumerated type that represents error severity codes for XML read operations. TErrorSeverity is the type used to represent error codes in EXMLReadError, and passed as an argument to the error handler in the TXMLReader.

element.name: TErrorSeverity.esWarning
element.short: Error is a warning

element.name: TErrorSeverity.esError
element.short: Error is an Error (not a Warning)

element.name: TErrorSeverity.esFatal
element.short: Error is an unrecoverable Fatal Error

element.name: TXMLReaderFlag
element.short: Represents options enabled when reading XML content
element.descr: TXMLReaderFlag is an enumerated type with values for options enabled when reading XML content. TXMLReaderFlag values are stored in the TXMLReaderFlags set type, and passed as an argument to the ReadXMLFile, ReadXMLFragment, and ReadDTDFile routines.

element.name: TXMLReaderFlag.xrfAllowLowerThanInAttributeValue
element.short: Indicates the < character is allowed in attribute values

element.name: TXMLReaderFlag.xrfAllowSpecialCharsInAttributeValue
element.short: Indicates control characters and reserved XML characters are allowed in XML content

element.name: TXMLReaderFlag.xrfAllowSpecialCharsInComments
element.short: Indicates if '--' is allowed in an XML comment

element.name: TXMLReaderFlag.xrfPreserveWhiteSpace
element.short: Indicates whitespace is preserved when reading XML content

element.name: TXMLReaderFlags
element.short: Set type used to store options enabled when reading XML content

descr.p: TXMLReaderFlags is a set type used to store zero or more values from the TXMLReaderFlag enumeration. TXMLReaderFlags is the type passed as an argument to the ReadXMLFile, ReadXMLFragment, and ReadDTDFile routines.

element.name: EXMLReadError
element.short: Exception raised when reading XML content

descr.p: EXMLReadError is an Exception descendant raised when an error occurs while reading XML content. EXMLReadError provides properties that indicate the severity of the error, its error message, and the position where the error occurred.
EXMLReadError is used in the TXMLReader implementation class which de-serializes XML documents.

element.name: EXMLReadError.Severity
element.short: Severity for the XML read error

descr.p: Severity is a read-only TErrorSeverity property that identifies the severity of the error. The value in Severity is assigned when an error is encountered, and an exception is created in TXMLReader.
Use ErrorMessage to get the description for the error condition. Use Line and LinePos to determine the line and column numbers in the XML input source where the error was encountered.

element.name: EXMLReadError.ErrorMessage
element.short: Error message for the XML read error

descr.p: ErrorMessage is a read-only String property that contains a description for the error condition. The value in ErrorMessage is assigned when the exception is created in TXMLReader.
Use Severity to determine the error level for the exception. Use Line and LinePos to get the line and column numbers where the error occurred in the XML input source.

element.name: EXMLReadError.Line
element.short: Line number in the XML content where the error occurred

element.name: EXMLReadError.LinePos
element.short: Offset in the line where the error occurred

element.name: EXMLReadError.LineCol
element.short: TPoint with the line and column numbers where the error occurred

element.name: EXMLReadError.LineCol.Result
element.short: Value for the TPoint type

element.name: ReadXMLFile
element.short: Reads the content of an XML file into the specified XML document

descr.p: ReadXMLFile is an overloaded procedure used to read the XML content from the specified source. Overloaded variants are provided which use a file name, a Text type, a File type, or a Stream as the input source.

When using the variant that specifies AFileName, the parameter must represent a valid file name. An exception is raised if AFileName does not exist on the local file system. The value in AFileName is converted to a File URI and used as the BaseURI in the XML Document.

The Flags parameter contains TXMLReaderFlag values enabled in the routine. The default value for the parameter is an empty set ([]), and indicates that no options are enabled by default. Values in the Flags parameter control the behavior enabled when XML content is de-serialized.

ReadXMLFile creates a TXMLReader instance that is used to read, parse, and store the values from the XML input source using its ProcessXML method. Values read in the routine are stored in the TXMLDocument instance in ADoc.

element.name: ReadXMLFile.ADoc
element.short: XML document populated in the routine

element.name: ReadXMLFile.AFilename
element.short: File name with the XML content read in the routine

element.name: ReadXMLFile.Flags
element.short: Options enabled when reading the XML content

element.name: ReadXMLFile.f
element.short: Stream with the XML content read in the routine

element.name: ReadXMLFile.ABaseURI
element.short: Base URI for XML content read in the routine

element.name: ReadXMLFragment
element.short: Reads an XML fragment into the specified DOM Node

descr.p: ReadXMLFragment is an overloaded procedure used to read an XML Document Fragment from the specified input source. Overloaded variants are provided that use a file name, a File type, a Text type, or a stream as the input source for the routine. Values read in the method are stored as children in the DOM Node specified in AParentNode.

When using the variant that specifies AFileName, the parameter must represent a valid file name. An exception is raised if AFileName does not exist on the local file system. The value in AFileName is converted to a File URI and used as the BaseURI in the XML Document.

The Flags parameter contains TXMLReaderFlag values enabled in the routine. The default value for the parameter is an empty set ([]), and indicates that no options are enabled by default. Values in the Flags parameter control the behavior enabled when XML content is de-serialized.
ReadXMLFragment creates a TXMLReader instance that is used to read, parse, and store the values from the XML input source using its ProcessFragment method.

element.name: ReadXMLFragment.AParentNode
element.short: DOM Node used as the parent for the XML fragment

element.name: ReadXMLFragment.AFilename
element.short: File name with the XML content read in the routine

element.name: ReadXMLFragment.Flags
element.short: Options enabled while reading XML content

element.name: ReadXMLFragment.f
element.short: Stream with the XML content read in the routine

element.name: ReadXMLFragment.ABaseURI
element.short: Base URI for XML content read in the routine

element.name: ReadDTDFile
element.short: Reads and stores a DTD file into the specified XML document

element.name: ReadDTDFile.AFilename

element.name: ReadDTDFile.f

element.name: ReadDTDFile.ABaseURI

element.name: TDOMParseOptions.PreserveWhitespace

element.name: TXMLContextAction
element.short: Values that control how XML content is stored in a DOM sub-tree

descr.p: TXMLContextAction is an enumeration type with values that control how XML content is stored in the DOM sub-tree for a specified context. TXMLContextAction represents the value passed as an argument to the TDOMParser.ParseWithContext method.

element.name: TXMLContextAction.xaAppendAsChildren
element.short: DOM Fragment is appended as child nodes

element.name: TXMLContextAction.xaReplaceChildren
element.short: DOM Fragment replaces child nodes

element.name: TXMLContextAction.xaInsertBefore
element.short: DOM Fragment is inserted before child nodes

element.name: TXMLContextAction.xaInsertAfter
element.short: DOM Fragment is appended after child nodes

element.name: TXMLContextAction.xaReplace
element.short: DOM Fragment replaces child nodes

element.name: TXMLErrorEvent
element.short: Event type signalled when an error occurs while processing XML content

descr.p: TXMLErrorEvent is an object procedure type that specifies an event signalled when an error occurs while reading and parsing XML content. TXMLErrorEvent is the type used for the TDOMParsser.OnError event handler, and allows the parser and its TXMLReader class instance to share error information and control.

element.name: TXMLErrorEvent.Error
element.short: Exception for the event notification

element.name: TXMLInputSource
element.short: Represents the input source for XML content

descr.p: TXMLInputSource is a class used to represent an input source for XML content. TXMLInputSource is based on the DOM InputSource interface from DOM Level 3. It is not a fully compliant implementation of the interface. It does not implement separate byteStream and characterStream properties; the Stream and StringData properties are provided instead. In addition, it does not implement the Encoding property. All values in are expected to use the UTF-8 encoding.
Use the overloaded constructors to create an input source with either a string or a stream as the storage for the XML content.

A TXMLInputSource instance is passed as an argument to the TDOMParser.Parse and TDOMParser.ParseWithContext methods. The instance is subsequently passed to the TXMLReader instance that reads XML content from the input source.

element.name: TXMLInputSource.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the overloaded constructor for the class instance. The variants allow the content for the input source to be assigned using a String or a TStream descendant. Both variants call the inherited constructor to initialize the class instance. The values in AStringData and AStream are assigned to their corresponding properties.

element.name: TXMLInputSource.Create.AStream
element.short: Stream with the content for the XML input source

element.name: TXMLInputSource.Create.AStringData
element.short: Values used as the content for the XML input source

element.name: TXMLInputSource.Stream
element.short: Stream with the XML content for the input source
element.descr: Stream is a read-only TStream property that contains the TStream descendant with the XML content for the input source. The value in Stream is assigned in the Create constructor.

element.name: TXMLInputSource.StringData
element.short: String with the XML content for the input source
element.descr: StringData is a read-only String property that contains the XML content for the input source. The value in StringData is assigned in the Create constructor.

element.name: TXMLInputSource.BaseURI
element.short: Base URI for content in the XML input source

descr.p: BaseURI is a String property that represents the absolute resource identifier used to resolve relative URIs found in the XML input source. BaseURI contains the value passed as an argument to the ReadXMLFile, ReadXMLFragment, and ReadDTDFile routines. BaseURI is supplied to TXMLReader and TDOMParser to resolve relative URIs when processing the XML input source.

element.name: TXMLInputSource.SystemID
element.short: System Identifier for content in the XML input source

descr.p: SystemID is a String property that represents the System Identifier for content in the XML input source. SystemID normally contains a URL for the resource.

The initial value in SystemID is the BaseURI passed as an argument to the ReadXMLFile, ReadXMLFragment, and ReadDTDFile routines. SystemID is updated when TXMLReader is used to resolve entity references, notations, or document types in the XML content for the input source.

element.name: TDOMParser
element.short: Implements a parser used to de-serialize XML content into DOM Nodes

descr.p: TDOMParser is a class which implements a DOM Parser component. TDOMParser provides methods to parse XML content specified by its URI or using an XML input source. TDOMParser creates DOM nodes needed to represent the XML content, and stores the nodes in a TXMLDocument instance or a DOM content node.
Use the Options property to enable specific features or behavior in the parser. Of particular importance is the Validate, which enables validation when processing XML content in the parser.

DOM (Document Object Model) does not specify an interface for a parser class. TDOMParser utilizes the TXMLReader class to perform the actions required to convert and de-serialize XML content. TXMLReader closely resembles the XMLReader class defined in SAX (Simple API for XML), but uses its own methods instead of Handler class instances to process various DOM Node types. TXMLReader is compliant with the XML 1.0 specification.

element.name: TDOMParser.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. Create allocates resources needed for the Options property.

element.name: TDOMParser.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for the class instance. Destroy frees resources allocated to the Options property, and calls the inherited destructor.

element.name: TDOMParser.Parse
element.short: Parses the input source and updates the specified XML document

descr.p: Parse is a procedure used to read and process the XML content in the specified XML input source. Parse creates DOM nodes needed to represent the XML content, and adds them to the specified TXMLDocument.
Parse creates TXMLReader and TXMLCharSource class instances that are used to convert and process the XML content in Src.
ADoc is an output parameter that represents the TXMLDocument created and updated in the XML reader class instance.

element.name: TDOMParser.Parse.Src
element.short: XML input source with content parsed in the method

element.name: TDOMParser.Parse.ADoc
element.short: XML Document updated in the method

element.name: TDOMParser.ParseUri
element.short: Parses XML content from the specified URI into the XML document

descr.p: ParseURI is a procedure used to read and process the XML content from the specified URI. ParseURI creates DOM nodes needed to represent the XML content, and adds them to the specified TXMLDocument.

ParseURI creates TXMLReader and TXMLCharSource class instances that are used to convert and process the XML content in URI. The value in URI is resolved to determine the absolute URI used when processing the XML content.
ADoc is an output parameter that represents the TXMLDocument created and updated in the XML reader class instance.

element.name: TDOMParser.ParseUri.URI
element.short: URI with the content parsed in the method

element.name: TDOMParser.ParseUri.ADoc
element.short: XML document updated in the method

element.name: TDOMParser.ParseWithContext
element.short: Parses the XML input source into the specified DOM context Node

descr.p: ParseWithContext is a TDOMNode function used to read and process XML content in the specified XML input source. ParseWithContext creates DOM nodes needed to represent the XML content.

The newly created DOM nodes are accumulated in a temporary DOM Document Fragment, and its child nodes are ultimately added to the DOM node in Context. The insertion point for the new nodes is determined using the Action argument. When Action contains xaAppendAsChildren or xaReplaceChildren, the nodes are added (or replaced) as child nodes in Context. When Action contains xaInsertBefore, xaInsertAfter, or xaReplace, the nodes are added (or replaced) as child nodes in the parent node for Context.

ParseWithContext creates a TXMLReader that is used to convert and process the XML content in the XML input source. The return value contains the first child node in the DOM Document Fragment created in the method.

errors.p: An EDOMNotSupported is raised when Action contains xaReplaceChildren and the target node is also a DOM Document node. Replacing the DOM Document is not supported in TDOMParser.
An EDOMHierarchyRequest exception is raised when the target node is not a DOM Element or Document Fragment node.

element.name: TDOMParser.ParseWithContext.Result
element.short: Not used in the current implementation

element.name: TDOMParser.ParseWithContext.Src
element.short: XML input source for the operation

element.name: TDOMParser.ParseWithContext.Context
element.short: DOM Node that provides the context for DOM nodes read in the method

element.name: TDOMParser.ParseWithContext.Action

element.name: TDOMParser.Options
element.short: Options for the DOM parser
element.descr: Options is a read-only TDOMParseOptions property that represents options settings used when processing XML content in the parser.

element.name: TDOMParser.OnError

element.descr: OnError is a TXMLErrorEvent property that implements the event handler signalled when a error occurs while reading or processing XML content in the parser.
